recommendations: October 9, 2016, Colton and Phillip were students together

I met Phillip through a Facebook group related to web development. We spent the next several months pair programming on a daily basis, creating all kinds of apps, large and small.At first, Phillip was a Ruby/Rails guy with great front-end chops, as well, but when I expressed that I didn't want to work with Ruby on our full stack projects, Phillip quickly adjusted to my Node/Express suggestions. In fact, we paired quite a bit on the backend at first, but Phillip quickly surpassed me in back-end ability, adding all kinds of functionality and using tools that I hadn't even tinkered with yet. After I returned from a week long absense, Phillip had added user authentication/management and all sorts of features to our app on the front end and back!Phillip is an extremely fast learner who has shown that he understands so much more than syntax and basic concepts, as he never failed to learn something new.Lastly, Phillip has the leadership ability that lots of us lack. He is a go getter. He brings people together, collaborates to set goals, holds people accountable, and does not quit. There were multiple projects that I lost interest in, but Phillip kept it going, and kept me in the game.

summary: Building web-based software is what I love. There's nothing else I'd rather do.I currently write complex React UIs all day every day, utilizing ES6+, Flow/TypeScript, Webpack, MobX, Redux, and so many other bleeding edge technologies.My main strength is in my understanding of core JavaScript. It enables me to pick up any new tools without a hitch. I feel that I am highly skilled for a developer of my experience and class, but acknowledge and embrace that I have a lot of learning to do, yet.I am also very fluent with Node. And, because I'm a hipster, I love writing functional JavaScript. :)I want to work on a team that is close, friendly, helpful, open-'minded and passionate. I seek an employer with "culture", somewhere that will allow me to be me, a human, rather than expecting me to be a suit with flawless etiquette.
name: Colton Colcleasure
title: Front End Developer at Sabre Corporation (React, MobX, Webpack, TypeScript)
